page.title: 12DALDOWIE SEWERAGE WORKS
page.content: {DALDOWIE SEWERAGE WORKS }are on the site of Daldowie House on the north bank of the Clyde.They were built at a cost of one million pounds in 1975.They treat sewage from our survey block as well as Uddingston, Bothwell, and Baillieston. In the preliminary treatment area large objects are removed.Next the grease is removed.Thereafter biological action purifies the sewage as it trickles down to the bottom of the filter tanks.In the last stage suspended matter settles allowing water clean enough to filter into the Clyde. Daldowie has a dry weather flow of 5 million gallons /day .It copes with a population of 36000. In wet weather it copes with a higher flow with the gutters flowing.
